headline: DHS Secretary Noem’s purse stolen at Easter dinner with family in D.C.
description: The theft occurred as Homeland Security Secretary Kristi L. Noem dined with her extended family at the Capital Burger on Seventh Street NW, people familiar with the incident said.

headline: How is a new pope chosen?
description: Selecting a new pope is a centuries-old process involving rounds of secretive voting, speeches, prayers and a dose of political maneuvering.

headline: What happens after the pope dies? From tolling bells to conclave smoke.
description: Pope Francis laid out guidelines for a simplified funeral before a conclave convenes at the Sistine Chapel to select his successor.

headline: Who Sits Where in Trump’s West Wing
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: See how the Trump administration has divvied up the West Wing, the formal workspace of the president and senior staff members.

headline: How Francis, the second-oldest pope in modern history, compared with others
description: Pope Francis, the second-oldest pope in modern history, has passed away at the age of 88, leaving behind a legacy of change in the Catholic Church.

headline: These Maps Show Federal Employees Work in Every Corner of America
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Before the Trump administration’s cuts, members of the civilian federal work force were in every state and in thousands of the nation’s cities and small towns.

headline: Travel to the U.S. from almost everywhere is falling under Trump
description: Charts show the scale of a steep drop in visitors from key countries and regions after President Donald Trump returned to office.

headline: Where does hurricane waste go? We tracked it with Air Tags to find out.
description: The small 1.54-square-mile Treasure Island would produce over 128,000 cubic yards of debris after the storms — roughly 2 million standard kitchen trash bags worth of waste.

headline: The Pour-igin of Species
description: No description available

headline: Here’s what the U.S. imports from China and what could get pricier with tariffs
description: Clothes, shoes, toys and yes, smartphones: See the Chinese imports Americans depend on

headline: How the White House Press Briefing Is Changing
label: https://www.nytimes.com/video/
description: The Trump administration is considering taking control of the seating in the White House press briefing room from the independent White House Correspondents’ Association. Ashley Wu, a graphics reporter for The New York Times, explains why this matters and notes how questions at the briefings have already started to change.

headline: Inside the Changing White House Briefing Room
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The Trump administration has given more time to “new media” and outlets that are more supportive of the president’s policies.

headline: Los segundos previos al derrumbe del techo del Jet Set en Santo Domingo, en imágenes
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/
description: Un video grabado en el lugar de los hechos muestra que ya caían escombros del techo de la discoteca antes de que se derrumbara.

headline: Home prices are dropping in some cities. See what it’s like in your neighborhood.
description: Search by Zip code to see how home prices are changing in your area.

headline: Why it’s hard to save money making your house more energy efficient
description: Going green at home can reduce emissions — but also raise your utility bills. The Post asked experts to do the math on a real-life scenario.

headline: Hear the sounds of spring in your area
description: Listen to calls of the most common migratory birds near you as the weather warms.

headline: Why Elon Musk Hasn’t Come Close to Finding $1 Trillion in Cuts
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: He seems to be realizing something that budget nerds have long known.

headline: Photos point to Israeli tank fire in deadly strike on U.N. guest house
description: Experts say images obtained by The Post show blast patterns and shell fragments that are consistent with two Israeli tank shells. The IDF has denied responsibility for the strike, which killed a European aid worker.

headline: Paris said au revoir to cars. Air pollution maps reveal a dramatic change.
description: Air pollution fell substantially as the city restricted car traffic and made way for parks and bike lanes.

headline: How Much Are Tariffs on Chinese Goods? It’s Trickier Than You Think.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The tariff rate on Chinese imports can be as high as 245% or zero, depending on the type of product that is being imported.

headline: See the Moments Leading Up to the Nightclub Roof Collapse in Santo Domingo
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Video taken at the scene shows debris was already falling from the ceiling of the Jet Set nightclub before it caved in.

headline: How Snow Becomes Deadly
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: This season, more than 20 people died in avalanches in the U.S. Can mountains be safer?

headline: ¿Qué derechos tienen las personas migrantes en EE. UU.?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/es/
description: Esto es lo que no ha cambiado, lo que se ha ampliado o restringido, y lo que está en disputa desde que inició el gobierno de Trump.

headline: See why Trump’s reversal actually increased tariff rates
description: The average effective tariff rate has increased in spite of Trump’s reversal, with China’s rate rising to 145 percent.

headline: How Palestinian first responders ended up in a mass grave in Gaza
description: Israel says they were fired on for moving “suspiciously.” Dispatcher records, witness testimony, and video and audio evidence offer a more disturbing narrative.

headline: Why BLTs under Trump have gone up | Opinion
description: In partnership with Numerator, we’re tracking inflation over more than 30 essential ingredients you may consume daily.

headline: How every House member voted on the ‘big, beautiful’ budget bill
description: The House passed a budget resolution laying out a framework for President Donald Trump’s  legislative priorities. See how your lawmaker voted.

headline: Hundreds of Israeli Air Force Reservists Call for Halt to Gaza War
label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/
description: A letter signed by reservists and retired officers accused the government of endangering hostages held by Hamas, highlighting a growing divide over the handling of the war.

headline: Scientists are x-raying the Amazon, unlocking a lost human history
description: Brazilian researchers are using laser technology to unearth a lost Portuguese colony and challenge long-held beliefs about human settlement in the Amazon.

headline: How Each House Member Voted on the Republican Budget
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The House voted 216 to 214 to approve a budget blueprint, a first step towards passing President Trump’s plans for spending and tax cuts.

headline: House Republicans Passed a New Budget. Here’s What’s in It.

description: It calls for more tax cuts and fewer reductions in spending. It would increase the federal debt by a lot more.

headline: U.S. Slashes Many of the Aid Programs It Had Promised to Keep
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: The U.N. food program said the new cuts “could amount to a death sentence” for millions of desperate people.

headline: Trump Wants to Merge Government Data. Here Are 314 Things It Might Know About You.

description: Elon Musk’s team is leading an effort to link government databases, to the alarm of privacy and security experts.

headline: What Rights Do Immigrants Have?
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: The expansion of immigration enforcement actions by the Trump administration has thrown the status of some rights into question. See what is unchanged, what is expanded and what is in dispute.

headline: Clint Hill remembered as the devoted agent who ran to JFK’s car in Dallas
description: Secret Service agent Clint Hill hurled himself atop President John F. Kennedy’s uncovered limousine when Lee Harvey Oswald opened fire in November 1963.

headline: No Big Stick: Many Tariff Targets Avoid Hitting Back
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Just two of the 20 largest exporters to the United States have matched Mr. Trump’s moves with new tariffs of their own.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/

headline: List: Who Trump Has Targeted for Retribution

headline: 10-Minute Challenge: ‘The Seasons’ by Lee Krasner
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: We’d like you to look at one piece of art for 10 minutes, uninterrupted.

headline: What makes Alex Ovechkin’s shot so unstoppable?
description: Ovechkin’s trademark one-timer has been an NHL wonder for two decades. Here’s why it can be a goalie’s worst nightmare.

headline: Duke has a long history of elite NBA prospects. Cooper Flagg is the best.
description: As he prepares to lead the Blue Devils into the Final Four, Flagg stacks up favorably to the long list of household names who starred for Duke over the decades.

headline: How Measles Attacks an Unvaccinated Child
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: With falling vaccination rates and outbreaks that have caused more than 580 U.S. cases and at least two deaths, health experts expect hundreds or even thousands more to be infected in the coming months.

headline: Here’s where prices could rise the most and least under Trump’s tariffs
description: Shoppers will see uneven price increases on imported goods.

headline: Where Trump’s Tariffs Will Hit Hardest
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: These economies are deeply reliant on selling goods to the United States, and many of them were hit with especially steep taxes.

headline: Could your name belong to a hurricane? Find out.
description: When it comes to naming a hurricane, not every name has what it takes. Could a hurricane ever be named Mortimer, Nixon or Helene?

headline: Are food prices really rising? This tracker offers a clue.
description: In partnership with Numerator, we’re tracking inflation over more than 30 essential ingredients for your daily food consumption.

headline: Trump touted these ICE arrests. Half were already in prison.

description: The answer appears to begin with the total trade deficit America runs with its trading partners.

headline: HHS layoffs include head of the World Trade Center Health Program
description: As part of its widespread layoffs at U.S. health agencies, the Trump administration fired John Howard, the longtime head of the World Trade Center Health Program.

headline: Trump Tariffs: See Which Countries Have the Highest Rates
label: https://www.nytimes.com/business/
description: President Trump unveiled sweeping tariffs that included actions on dozens of countries at very high levels.

headline: The War on Nature in Ukraine

description: Fires and smoke foul the air. Toxins seep into the earth and water. Habitats for wildlife disappear. Experts call it ecocide.

headline: These old Roman buildings could unlock how to build in a warming world
description: The recycled buildings of Rome, long dismissed by architects, are getting a reappraisal as a model for how to reduce waste while creating something fresh.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/business/
description: The president said the charges, at least 10 percent on nearly all trading partners, would restore fairness, but experts warned they could destabilize the world’s economy.

headline: Nine GOP House members defy Speaker Mike Johnson on new parent proxy voting measure
description: The group of Republicans teamed up with Democrats to overcome a procedural hurdle backed by GOP leadership that would have blocked a proposed resolution allowing new parents in Congress to vote remotely.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: Nine Republicans joined Democrats to force a vote to allow members who had new children to vote by proxy.

headline: How to use your voice to ease stress and calm down
description: Humming can have positive effects on the part of the brain that controls mood, anxiety, cognition and memory. Follow these exercises to use your voice to relax.

description: We explore what federal government spends its money on.

headline: The Generational Legacy of Samples in Music
description: No description available

description: Americans who like to drink alcohol from Europe will have to spend lot more to indulge if the Trump administration makes good on its tariff threats.

description: D.C. employees of the institute, founded and funded by Congress, received late-night termination notices, though most of its overseas staff were left in place.

headline: The Federal Work Force Cuts So Far, Agency by Agency

description: Here are the layoffs, buyouts taken and planned reductions, by agency, that The New York Times has confirmed.

headline: Final Cuts Will Eliminate U.S. Aid Agency in All but Name
label: https://www.nytimes.com/us/
description: The staff of U.S.A.I.D. will be reduced to some 15 legally required positions. The agency employed about 10,000 people before the Trump administration entered office.

headline: Trump uses power and police to help DOGE access independent agencies
description: Trump officials have turned to law enforcement officers to help the U.S. DOGE Service led by Elon Musk gain control of independent agencies.

description: The cost-cutting strategy of the group, led by billionaire Elon Musk, has played out at more than 30 agencies so far.

headline: Las deportaciones no han aumentado con Trump, pero así es como han cambiado

description: Según una revisión de The New York Times, desde que Trump asumió el cargo se han realizado 258 vuelos de deportación, el nivel alcanzado en los últimos meses del gobierno de Biden.

headline: See all the tariffs Trump has enacted, threatened and canceled
description: Get a day-by-day look at how Trump’s trade war has unfolded and where it stands now.

headline: 1 in 8 Californians now face extreme fire danger, Post analysis shows
description: One in 8 Californians now live in places at risk for the kinds of devastating wildfires that tore through Los Angeles this winter, according to a Washington Post analysis of new state fire maps.

headline: Sneeze smarter, not louder: The science of a quieter sneeze
description: At a certain point, there’s no stopping a sneeze. But doctors say there are ways to turn down the volume of an “achoo.”

headline: Health benefits company co-founded by Dr. Oz could be a conflict of interest
description: Trump’s nominee to lead the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services is entangled in another potential conflict of interest in the health-care space, ethics experts, lawyers and health care analysts say,

description: Max Park is a longtime speedcubing world record holder — for the 3x3x3 cube, his best official time is 3.13 seconds. Let's show you how he does it.

headline: The Online Casinos That Can Operate as Long as They Say They Aren’t Actually Casinos
label: https://www.nytimes.com/upshot/
description: Policing loopholes in gambling law can be challenging, and most states have been slow to adapt.

headline: Greenland is hard to defend. As Trump threatens, the Danes are trying.
description: “One way or the other,” President Donald Trump told Congress, the United States needs to “get” Greenland, strategically located and rich in rare metals.

label: https://www.nytimes.com/world/

headline: Deportations Haven’t Surged Under Trump. But Here’s How They’ve Changed.
label: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/
description: An analysis of flight data shows how the Trump administration is using extraordinary means to deport people.
